title: Add resize command for agent terminal size
description: Allow resizing an agent's terminal after spawn. Add 'botty resize <id> --rows N --cols M' command. Currently rows/cols are only configurable at spawn time via --rows and --cols flags.
close_reason: Added resize command to change agent terminal size after spawn

title: Implement prompt detection heuristics
description: Detect common shell prompts ($ , > , etc.) and TUI ready states. Configurable patterns.
close_reason: Added wait_for_prompt with common shell patterns, wait_for_prompt_custom, wait_for_absence, and contains helper

title: Validate signal numbers in kill command
description: Client-supplied signal number should be validated against allowlist (1-31) rather than silently falling back to SIGTERM.
close_reason: Added validation to reject signal numbers outside 1-31 range

title: Propagate exit code from exec command
description: exec currently always returns 0 even if the command failed. Should capture and propagate the actual exit code so agents can detect failures.
close_reason: Implemented in commit e9e8dd4

title: Implement snapshot command
description: Return normalized screen text from vt100 parser. Strip ANSI colors by default. Support --raw for full cell attributes.
close_reason: Implemented snapshot command with --raw flag for ANSI codes

title: Implement attach command (TTY bridging)
description: Bridge user terminal to agent PTY. Put user terminal in raw mode. Forward input/output bidirectionally. Handle window resize (SIGWINCH).
close_reason: Implemented attach mode with Ctrl+A d detach sequence and readonly option

title: Fix --replay missing newline between snapshot and stream
description: When using 'botty tail --replay', the snapshot output doesn't include a trailing newline, causing the first streamed line to concatenate with the last snapshot line.
close_reason: Added newline after snapshot if content doesn't end with one

title: Design and implement agent orchestration test framework
description: Create a testing framework for the primary use case: one coding agent spawning and coordinating multiple TUI agents. Need to handle snapshot-based assertions, timing, and realistic multi-agent scenarios.
close_reason: Completed test framework with TestHarness, AgentHandle, wait_for_* methods, prompt detection, and 7 orchestration scenarios

title: Server skeleton with Unix socket listener
description: Create server module with tokio-based Unix socket listener, handle incoming connections, dispatch to request handlers. Include auto-fork/daemonize logic.
close_reason: Implemented server with Unix socket listener, request handling, PTY output polling

title: Use SIGKILL as default for kill command
description: Interactive shells (bash) ignore SIGTERM, requiring users to remember -9. Change default to SIGKILL for reliable cleanup. Add --term flag for graceful SIGTERM when needed.
close_reason: Implemented in commit defabd5

title: Protocol types (Request/Response enums)
description: Define all message types for client-server IPC: Spawn, List, Kill, Send, SendBytes, Tail, Dump, Snapshot, Attach, Shutdown requests and corresponding responses
close_reason: Implemented Request/Response enums with serde serialization and unit tests

title: Add integration tests for attach mode
description: Attach mode has zero test coverage. Need tests for: attach/detach flow, detach key sequence, read-only mode, agent exit during attach.
close_reason: Added 5 integration tests for attach mode: attach/detach, readonly, nonexistent agent, output reception, agent exit

title: Attach mode drops input after typing a few characters
description: Input to attached terminal is inconsistent - works fine initially but progressively drops more input after typing a few characters. Likely a bug in the I/O bridge or buffering logic.
close_reason: Fixed: background pty_reader_task was competing with attach bridge for PTY reads. Added 'attached' flag to skip agents during attach.

title: Structured agent messaging protocol
description: Agents can emit __BOTTY_MSG:{json}__ markers. Orchestrator retrieves via 'botty recv <id>'. Enables agents to communicate structured data back.

title: Change list to show only running agents by default, add --all flag
description: botty list should only show running agents. Add --all to include exited ones. Keeps the list clean for active orchestration.
close_reason: Implemented in commit 5b6b3b1

title: Implement tail --follow for streaming output
description: The --follow flag exists but isn't implemented. Should stream new output as it arrives, essential for watching long-running commands.
close_reason: Implemented in commit 41400ee

title: Add TOON output format for list command
description: Default to TOON format for list output (token-efficient for LLMs). Add --json flag for piping to jq. Use the toon-format crate (official implementation) for encoding. TOON is ideal for tabular agent data.
close_reason: Implemented in commit e9c7bab

title: Implement send command (UTF-8 input)
description: Write UTF-8 text to agent PTY. Support --newline flag to auto-append \n.
close_reason: Implemented send command with --no-newline flag

title: View shows panes for killed agents
description: After killing an agent, 'botty view' still shows a pane for it. The view command should only show running agents, and the event loop should properly remove panes when agents exit.
close_reason: Kill and recreate tmux session on view to avoid stale panes

title: Add --name flag to spawn for custom agent IDs
description: Allow botty spawn --name my-worker -- bash. Makes it easier to refer to agents by role rather than random names.
close_reason: Implemented in commit f4256f0

title: CLI with clap (command definitions)
description: Create CLI using clap derive macros: spawn, list, kill, send, send-bytes, tail, dump, snapshot, attach, server subcommands. Wire up to client calls.
close_reason: Implemented CLI with clap: spawn, list, kill, send, send-bytes, tail, dump, snapshot, attach, server, shutdown

title: Fix clippy: add #[must_use] attributes
description: Add #[must_use] attributes to ~27 functions that return values which shouldn't be silently discarded
close_reason: Fixed all clippy lints

title: Create TestHarness struct for managing server lifecycle
description: A test harness that handles server startup, client creation, and cleanup. Should support unique socket paths per test.
close_reason: Implemented TestHarness, AgentHandle, wait_for_content, wait_for_pattern, and wait_for_stable in testing module

title: Fix FD lifetime issue in attach bridge - potential use-after-free
description: In run_attach_bridge(), pty_fd is captured at attach start but the agent could be removed while the bridge is running. After drop(mgr), the fd may become invalid on next iteration. Need Arc<OwnedFd> or verify agent exists after each lock acquisition.
close_reason: Fixed by always acquiring lock before using PTY fd, never passing raw fd across async boundaries

title: Fix clippy: add const fn where possible
description: Add const to ~12 functions that can be evaluated at compile time
close_reason: Fixed all clippy lints

title: Output subscriptions: botty subscribe
description: Stream output from one or more agents as it arrives. Multiplexed streaming for watching multiple workers from one coordinator.

title: Agent struct and state management
description: Define Agent struct: id (adjective-noun), pid, pty_fd, state enum (Running/Stopped/Exited), exit_code. Use names crate for ID generation with collision handling.
close_reason: Implemented Agent struct with id, command, pty, state, transcript, screen

title: Implement tail command
description: Read last N lines from transcript. Support --follow mode for streaming new output.
close_reason: Implemented tail command (follow mode pending)

title: Implement wait_for_content with polling and timeout
description: Poll snapshot until content matches (substring or regex), with configurable timeout. Replaces brittle sleep-based waits.
close_reason: Implemented TestHarness, AgentHandle, wait_for_content, wait_for_pattern, and wait_for_stable in testing module

title: Virtual screen model with vt100 crate
description: Integrate vt100 crate for VT/ANSI screen parsing. Feed PTY output to parser. Track rows x cols, cursor position, alt-screen state.
close_reason: Implemented Screen struct with vt100 parser, process, snapshot, cursor_position methods

title: Create multi-agent orchestration test scenarios
description: Write example tests demonstrating: spawn multiple agents, coordinate between them, assert on each agent's state.
close_reason: Created 7 orchestration test scenarios covering: multi-worker spawning, agent pipelines, stateful agents, failure isolation, rapid spawn/kill, concurrent commands, TUI screen updates

title: Allow reusing names of exited agents
description: Currently, spawning an agent with a name that exists (even if exited) fails with 'agent name already in use'. Should allow reusing names of exited agents - either by auto-removing them or by checking state during spawn.
close_reason: Allow reusing names by removing exited agents before spawn

title: Implement spawn command end-to-end
description: Wire up spawn: CLI -> client -> server -> PTY creation -> agent registration. Return agent ID to client. Verify with list command.
close_reason: Implemented as part of CLI and server work - spawn works end-to-end

title: Client module for Unix socket IPC
description: Create client module: connect to socket, send Request, receive Response. Include auto-start logic (fork server on ENOENT/ECONNREFUSED).
close_reason: Implemented client with auto-connect, server auto-start, request/response handling

title: Configurable detach sequence for attach mode
description: Allow users to configure the detach key sequence via CLI flag or config file. Currently hardcoded to Ctrl+G d.
close_reason: Added --detach-key flag with support for ctrl-X, ^X, and single char notation

title: Read-only attach mode
description: Support --readonly flag for attach: forward output to user but discard input (except detach sequence).
close_reason: Implemented attach mode with Ctrl+A d detach sequence and readonly option

title: Event streaming: botty events
description: Stream JSON events for agent lifecycle (spawned, output, exited). Enables reactive orchestration without polling. This is the key differentiator from tmux.
close_reason: Implemented event streaming with botty events command

title: Add symlink check for socket path to prevent /tmp attacks
description: Socket path in /tmp could be symlinked by attacker. Check for symlink before remove/bind, and prefer XDG_RUNTIME_DIR.
close_reason: Added socket permission 0o600 and symlink check in server startup

title: Implement dump command
description: Export transcript with options: --since timestamp, --format text|jsonl. JSONL includes timestamps per chunk.
close_reason: Implemented dump command with --since and --format options

title: Add --raw flag to snapshot for ANSI output
description: snapshot --raw flag exists but has bugs - the vt100 rows_formatted() output includes cursor positioning codes that cause garbled display. Need to investigate vt100 API more carefully or use a different approach. Currently the flag is broken.
close_reason: Fixed by implementing proper cell-by-cell iteration to emit ANSI codes without cursor positioning sequences

title: Change 'No running agents' message to avoid grep confusion
description: The message 'No running agents' contains the word 'running' which causes naive grep-based checks to match. Change to 'No agents currently running' or similar.
close_reason: Implemented in commit e9c7bab

title: Set explicit Unix socket permissions (0o700)
description: Socket permissions are determined by umask, which could allow other users to connect. Set explicit 0o700 permissions after binding.
close_reason: Added socket permission 0o600 and symlink check in server startup

title: Implement send-bytes command (raw input)
description: Write raw bytes to agent PTY. Accept hex-encoded or base64 input for control characters, escape sequences, etc.
close_reason: Implemented send-bytes command with hex-encoded input

title: Fix clippy: replace unwrap() with expect()

close_reason: Fixed all clippy lints

close_reason: Fixed all clippy lints

title: Fix clippy: add missing # Errors doc sections

close_reason: Implemented TestHarness, AgentHandle, wait_for_content, wait_for_pattern, and wait_for_stable in testing module

title: Fix clippy: inline format args

close_reason: Fixed all clippy lints

title: Agent labels/groups

title: Add botty doctor command
description: Diagnostic command to check: socket path writable, daemon running/startable, PTY allocation works, no stale sockets.
close_reason: Implemented botty doctor command with checks for socket, PTY, daemon, and spawn/kill cycle

title: Strip ANSI codes in tail output by default

title: Spawn dependencies: --after and --wait-for
description: 'botty spawn --after <id>' waits for agent to exit. 'botty spawn --wait-for <id> --pattern ready' waits for pattern. Declarative workflow sequencing.

title: Screen normalization (strip colors, regex filters)
description: Implement normalization options: strip ANSI, trim trailing whitespace, optional regex filters for volatile content (timestamps, PIDs).
close_reason: Implemented - snapshot already strips colors by default, --raw preserves them
